meanings.definition: The quality or state of being disloyal.
meanings.sent1: Her disloyalties to the team were evident when she shared their secrets with the rival.
meanings.sent2: The king was deeply hurt by the disloyalties of his closest advisors.
meanings.sent3: Despite his disloyalties, his friends forgave him and welcomed him back into their group.
meanings.sent4: The disloyalties of the spy were like a dagger in the heart of the nation's security.
meanings.sent5: The disloyalties of the employee were like a dark cloud hanging over the company.

meanings.sent1: The disloyalties of the double agent were finally exposed.
meanings.sent2: The history books are filled with tales of disloyalties that changed the course of empires.
meanings.sent3: The disloyalties of the cat to its owner included knocking over the vase and spilling water everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The disloyalties of the traitor echoed through the halls of the palace.
meanings.sent5: The disloyalties of the student to the school rules were met with swift consequences.
